description: This service delivers comprehensive design and documentation for an implementation-ready, application-specific landing zone in public cloud environments (Azure, AWS, GCP). The service provides detailed technical blueprints, architectural diagrams, and specifications that enable organizations to host applications safely and consistently within their established cloud foundation. The comprehensive scope of architectural design translates assessment outcomes and target architecture principles into concrete, actionable designs covering networking, identity and access management, security controls, compute patterns, data layer architecture, DevOps integration, monitoring strategies, and operational aspects. This holistic approach ensures all critical infrastructure components are designed to work together seamlessly while adhering to enterprise standards and compliance requirements.
notes: This service assumes that an Enterprise-Scale Landing Zone for the organization is already prepared and that basic architecture and design principles for deploying applications in cloud environments are defined within the organization.

usageScenarios.scenarioDescription: Organizations need a concrete design to translate infrastructure, platform, or application assessment findings into an actionable cloud deployment blueprint.
Before onboarding new applications to an existing enterprise landing zone, organizations require standardized application-specific designs that align with corporate cloud governance.
When building standardized application environments (production/non-production) that need consistent architecture patterns, security controls, and operational procedures.
When onboarding regulated or business-critical workloads that require detailed compliance mapping, security architecture, and audit-ready documentation.
When multiple development teams will deploy applications into a shared cloud foundation, requiring clear boundaries, access models, and resource isolation patterns.
Organizations migrating legacy applications to cloud need a dedicated landing zone design that accommodates specific technical requirements and integration dependencies.
When applications require multi-region resilience and business continuity designs integrated into the landing zone architecture.
Organizations requiring CI/CD-ready infrastructure designs with Infrastructure as Code integration points and automated deployment patterns.

items: Application landing zone architecture aligned with enterprise standards
Subscription / account structure for application workloads
Security controls (NSGs, firewalls, private endpoints, encryption)
Data encryption (at rest and in transit)
Identity & access model (RBAC, managed identities, service roles)
Service principal and managed identity patterns
Bill of Materials (logical design, not pricing)

outOfScope: Actual deployment or configuration of cloud resources
Security penetration testing or vulnerability assessments
Operational runbooks development (available as optional add-on)

other.toolName: Cost estimation calculators (AWS Pricing Calculator, Azure Pricing Calculator, GCP Pricing Calculator)

requiredByCustomer.description: EA/CSP/MCA agreement with subscription creation rights
AWS Organizations with account creation rights
GCP Organization with project creation rights
Access to enterprise identity provider (Microsoft Entra ID, Okta, etc.)

recommendedOptional.description: If applicable for advanced networking features

providedByServiceProvider.licenseName: Landing zone design templates and patterns

customerMustProvide: Designated project sponsor with decision authority
Technical lead with deep application knowledge
Access to existing assessment documentation and outputs
Timely responses to design decisions (SLA: 3 business days)
Feedback on proposed architectures within defined review cycles

accessRequirements.description: Read access to assessment outputs and documentation
Access to enterprise architecture artifacts and standards

serviceInputs.description: Total count of applications to onboard to the landing zone
Classification of each application (web, API, batch, data processing, legacy)
Uptime SLAs, RTO/RPO targets, HA requirements
Expected load patterns, scaling triggers, capacity projections
Latency, throughput, and response time requirements
Sensitivity levels and data handling requirements
Regulatory frameworks (GDPR, HIPAA, PCI-DSS, SOC2, etc.)
Systems, APIs, and services the application must integrate with
Target compute platform (VM / container / PaaS / serverless)
Desired operational responsibilities (central ops, DevOps, hybrid)
Current naming conventions, tagging policies, design standards
Data protection policies and retention periods
Budget limitations or cost optimization priorities

items.itemDescription: High-level summary of the architecture design
Documented principles and key design decisions
Logging strategy and log routing design
Log of design decisions and assumptions

items.itemDescription: Bill of Materials for all resources

multiCloudConsiderations.description: Create cloud-agnostic design patterns that can be implemented with provider-specific services
Establish naming standards that work across all target cloud platforms
Design for centralized identity with federation to multiple cloud providers
Consider multi-cloud network fabrics and consistent IP address management
Design for centralized observability across cloud boundaries
Use Terraform or Pulumi for cross-cloud infrastructure code consistency
Establish equivalent security controls mapped across cloud providers
